node.title: Vaccines alone won't stop Omicron. So which COVID measures are in place in your state?
node.alt: A man in blue scrubs and a white face mask is holding the arm of a woman in preparation for a vaccine.
node.description: The World Health Organization says vaccines alone "will not get any country out of this crisis" as Omicron spreads at an unprecedented rate. So what do they recommend will help? And what are the rules in your state?
node.content:
["The head of the World Health Organization (WHO) has warned the new Omicron variant is spreading at an unprecedented rate, and countries should not rely in vaccines alone to fight it.", "The Omicron variant has now been reported by 77 countries and is likely present in most worldwide, but should not be dismissed as \"mild\", WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.", "\"Even if Omicron does cause less severe disease, the sheer number of cases could once again overwhelm unprepared health systems,\" Dr Tedros said.", "\"It's not vaccines instead of masks. It's not vaccines instead of distancing. It's not vaccines instead of ventilation or hand hygiene. Do it all. Do it consistently. Do it well.\"", "With COVID-19 restrictions easing across the country, here are the current rules in place depending on where you live:", "
New South Wales
", "", "
Singing and dancing is permitted indoors and outdoors for all.(ABC News: Harriet Tatham)
", "A raft of COVID-19 restrictions have eased in NSW today, and, for the first time since June, unvaccinated people are being given significant freedoms too.", "From today there is no limit to the number of people allowed in your home, at outdoor public gatherings and at hospitality venues.", "Masks, while still strongly encouraged where social distancing isn't possible, have been dropped as a requirement in most indoor settings including in shops.", "But masks will still be required on public transport and planes, at airports and for indoor front-of-house hospitality staff who are not fully vaccinated.", "Plus, unvaccinated people will now have the same freedoms as vaccinated people.", "
Victoria
", "", "
Masks are\u00a0strongly recommended in Victoria where physical distancing is not possible.(ABC News: Ron Ekkel)
", "In Victoria, there is no requirement to wear face masks in most indoor and most outdoor settings but are strongly recommended where physical distancing is not possible.", "Masks are also strongly recommended for all students and staff in secondary schools. But masks remain a requirement indoors at retail, health, care and justice facilities, at primary schools, and on public transport, including taxis and rideshares.", "There are no density limits for hospitality venues for fully vaccinated customers, and events with fewer than 30,000 people in attendance can go ahead without a COVID-safe plan for the fully vaccinated.", "There are also no limits of the number of people who can gather in a home or in public places such as parks or beaches, but\u00a0the government has recommended that everyone be fully vaccinated.", "
Australian Capital Territory
", "", "
Masks are required on public transport and in all indoor spaces at schools in the ACT.\u00a0(Supplied.)
", "In the ACT, anyone over 12 must wear a face mask in high-risk settings, including hospitals and residential aged care facilities, on public transport and in all indoor spaces at schools and early childhood education settings.", "Indoor front-of-house hospitality staff are also required to wear a face mask when working.", "Face masks are strongly encouraged where physical distancing isn't possible, an indoor setting like retail and personal care services like hairdressing.", "There are no limits on the number of visitors allowed to gather in households or outdoors, but organised events must adhere to density limits.", "
Queensland
", "", "
There are no limits on the number of people who can gather in public outdoor spaces across Queensland.\u00a0(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Masks are mandatory in Queensland in certain circumstances such as in\u00a0airports and on domestic commercial flights.", "Those arriving from overseas or COVID-19 hotspots who are required to quarantine must wear a mask when travelling from the airport to a quarantine hotel.", "The same rule also applies to drivers transporting overseas or hotspot arrivals to quarantine locations.", "Otherwise, masks are only recommended in situations where social distancing is not possible.", "While there are no limits on the number of people who can gather in public outdoor spaces, gathers at private residences are capped at 100 people.", "
South Australia
", "", "
Face masks are still required in certain settings in South Australia.(AAP: James Gourley)
", "South Australia is currently operating under level 1 restrictions, meaning face masks are required in high-risk settings, personal care services, health care services, passenger transport services, indoor fitness facilities (except when exercising) and shared indoor public places.", "High-risk settings include residential aged care facilities, disability care facilities and certain parts of hospitals, such as the emergency department or ICU.", "In terms of density limits, non-seated events can only function at half the normal capacity, and gatherings at home are capped at 30 people.", "
Northern Territory
", "", "
The NT's mask mandate will end this Friday.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "A mask mandate is currently in place for Barunga, Beswick, Bulla, Daguragu, Katherine, Kalkarindji, Lajamanu, Manyallaluk, Pigeon Hole, Tennant Creek and Timber Creek until 2pm on Friday 17 December.", "Face masks must be worn outside of the home when it is not possible to maintain a physical distance of 1.5 metres, but do not have to be worn while exercising or playing sport.", "In less than a week, the Northern Territory will allow quarantine-free travel for all interstate arrivals, but PCR tests are required.", "
Western Australia
", "", "
Face masks will become mandatory in some settings in WA when the state opens its borders next year.(AAP: Dan Peled)
", "Right now, face masks are not mandatory in Western Australia.", "But come February 5 they will be required\u00a0on public transport, in taxis and rideshares, at airports and on flights, and for visitors to hospitals or aged or disability care.", "But masks will not be needed in other settings, like major sporting events or nightclubs.", "There are currently no capacity restrictions for venues and events, and that won't change come February 5 either.\u00a0", "
Tasmania
", "", "
After 22 months, Tasmania has lowered the drawbridge to fully vaccinated travellers.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Tasmania has now eased its border\u00a0restrictions, bringing with it a range of updated COVID-19 restrictions.\u00a0", "The government advises face masks \"must be worn by all people aged 12 and over\" at \"large events\" and \"during travel (in ports/airports and on board planes/the Spirit of Tasmania)\".", "It also states you need to wear a face mask \"in\u00a0or on the premises of\u00a0a public hospital,\u00a0private hospital, or a day-procedure facility\"."]
